Class FilenameLengthLimiter

java.lang.Object
  javax.swing.InputVerifier
      edu.umaryland.igs.idea.TextFieldInputVerifier
          edu.umaryland.igs.idea.StateDependentInputVerifier
              edu.umaryland.igs.idea.FileVerifier
                  edu.umaryland.igs.idea.FilenameLengthLimiter
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Cloneable
Direct Known Subclasses:
OmegaBasedFilenameLengthLimiter
public abstract class FilenameLengthLimiter
extends FileVerifier

FilenameLengthLimiter is an extension of FileVerifier common to text fields which restrict user input based on a maximum filename length imposed by PAML. A default parent directory is assumed if a relative path is given; the length of this parent directory's name is counted toward the maximum. The maximum length for a relative path (including the parent directory) may differ from that for an absolute path.

Written:

Copyright (C) 2007, Amy Egan and Joana C. Silva.

All rights reserved.

Author:
Amy Egan

maxAbsolutePathLength

abstract int maxAbsolutePathLength()
The maxAbsolutePathLength() method should return the maximum allowable length for an absolute path. This maximum may depend on other properties of the state.

Returns:
the maximum allowable length for an absolute path

maxRelativePathLength

abstract int maxRelativePathLength()
The maxRelativePathLength() method should return the maximum allowable length for a relative path. This maximum may depend on other properties of the state.

Returns:
the maximum allowable length for an relative path

maxLength

protected int maxLength(String filename)
The maxLength method returns this verifier's maximum length for the supplied filename, which may be either an absolute or a relative path.

Parameters:
filename - an absolute or relative filename

verifyText

public boolean verifyText(String text)
The verifyText method is declared by TextFieldInputVerifier. FilenameLengthLimiter's version returns whether the length of the filename being validated is less than or equal to a verifier's maximum for it. If the supplied filename is a relative path, the verifier's default parent is assumed, and the characters (if any) in its name are counted toward the maximum.

Specified by:
verifyText in class TextFieldInputVerifier
Parameters:
text - the text to validate, which should be an absolute or relative path to a (possibly nonexistent) file
Returns:
whether the filename's length is less than or equal to this verifier's maximum for it

errorMessage

String errorMessage(String text)
The errorMessage method is declared by TextFieldInputVerifier. FilenameLengthLimiter's version returns a string including the maximum number of allowed characters and the exact string that that exceeded that maximum.

Specified by:
errorMessage in class TextFieldInputVerifier
Parameters:
text - the filename which, alone or when appended to an assumed parent directory, was found to be too long
Returns:
a message including the maximum characters allowed and the exact string which exceeded the maximum
